thread.title: From worst to first: CVG flights among cheapest in nation
thread.title_full: From worst to first: CVG flights among cheapest in nation

author: Erin Caproni
title: From worst to first: CVG flights among cheapest in nation
text:
Enlarge The Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport has been ranked among the… more The Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport has been ranked among the nation’s most expensive for years, but it’s turning around in a drastic fashion. CheapFlights.com ranked CVG the nation’s cheapest airport inits most recent annual report. It was No. 77 on the list last year. The national ranking is based on average airfares found on the site in the month of June to popular domestic and international locations at 101 airports. CVG’s average was $199. The No. 2 airport, Atlanta International , also greatly improved from No. 73 on last year’s list with fares averaging $231. announced its plans to add a hub at the airport on Thursday. To take a look at the full list of the nation’s cheapest airports, click here.
